definitions.definition: Arising or originating from a figure of authority
examples: The authoritative rules in this school come not from the headmaster but from the aged matron.

definitions.definition: Highly accurate or definitive ; treated or worthy of treatment as a scholarly authority
examples: This book is the world's most authoritative guide to insect breeding habits.
He instructed us in that booming, authoritative voice of his.

main_definition: Arising or originating from a figure of authority
secondary_definitions: Highly accurate or definitive ; treated or worthy of treatment as a scholarly authority
